an5.159:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
an5.159:1.3: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
an5.159:1.5: went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an5.159:1.6: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”
an5.159:2.1: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.
an5.159:2.2: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.
an5.159:2.4: You should teach Dhamma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ …
an5.159:2.7: ‘I will not teach while secretly hoping to profit.’ …
an5.159:2.8: ‘I will teach without hurting myself or others.’
an5.159:2.9: It’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.
an5.159:2.10: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.”
